speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: SCENE III. The garden of the castle.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Enter DESDEMONA, CASSIO, and EMILIA

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Be thou assured, good Cassio, I will do

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: All my abilities in thy behalf.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Good madam, do: I warrant it grieves my husband,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: As if the case were his.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: O, that's an honest fellow. Do not doubt, Cassio,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But I will have my lord and you again

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: As friendly as you were.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Bounteous madam,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Whatever shall become of Michael Cassio,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: He's never any thing but your true servant.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I know't; I thank you. You do love my lord:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: You have known him long; and be you well assured

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: He shall in strangeness stand no further off

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Than in a polite distance.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Ay, but, lady,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That policy may either last so long,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Or feed upon such nice and waterish diet,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Or breed itself so out of circumstance,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That, I being absent and my place supplied,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: My general will forget my love and service.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Do not doubt that; before Emilia here

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I give thee warrant of thy place: assure thee,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If I do vow a friendship, I'll perform it

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To the last article: my lord shall never rest;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I'll watch him tame and talk him out of patience;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: His bed shall seem a school, his board a shrift;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I'll intermingle every thing he does

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: With Cassio's suit: therefore be merry, Cassio;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: For thy solicitor shall rather die

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Than give thy cause away.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Madam, here comes my lord.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Madam, I'll take my leave.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Why, stay, and hear me speak.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Madam, not now: I am very ill at ease,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Unfit for mine own purposes.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Well, do your discretion.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Exit CASSIO

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Enter OTHELLO and IAGO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Ha! I like not that.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What dost thou say?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nothing, my lord: or if--I know not what.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Was not that Cassio parted from my wife?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Cassio, my lord! No, sure, I cannot think it,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That he would steal away so guilty-like,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Seeing you coming.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I do believe 'twas he.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: How now, my lord!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I have been talking with a suitor here,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: A man that languishes in your displeasure.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Who is't you mean?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Why, your lieutenant, Cassio. Good my lord,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If I have any grace or power to move you,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: His present reconciliation take;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: For if he be not one that truly loves you,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: That errs in ignorance and not in cunning,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I have no judgment in an honest face:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I prithee, call him back.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Went he hence now?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Ay, sooth; so humbled

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: That he hath left part of his grief with me,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To suffer with him. Good love, call him back.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Not now, sweet Desdemona; some other time.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But shall't be shortly?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The sooner, sweet, for you.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Shall't be to-night at supper?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: No, not to-night.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To-morrow dinner, then?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I shall not dine at home;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I meet the captains at the citadel.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Why, then, to-morrow night; or Tuesday morn;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: On Tuesday noon, or night; on Wednesday morn:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I prithee, name the time, but let it not

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Exceed three days: in faith, he's penitent;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And yet his trespass, in our common reason--

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Save that, they say, the wars must make examples

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Out of their best--is not almost a fault

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To incur a private cheque. When shall he come?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Tell me, Othello: I wonder in my soul,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: What you would ask me, that I should deny,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Or stand so mammering on. What! Michael Cassio,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: That came a-wooing with you, and so many a time,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: When I have spoke of you dispraisingly,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Hath ta'en your part; to have so much to do

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To bring him in! Trust me, I could do much,--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Prithee, no more: let him come when he will;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I will deny thee nothing.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Why, this is not a boon;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: 'Tis as I should entreat you wear your gloves,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Or feed on nourishing dishes, or keep you warm,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Or sue to you to do a peculiar profit

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To your own person: nay, when I have a suit

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Wherein I mean to touch your love indeed,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: It shall be full of poise and difficult weight

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And fearful to be granted.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I will deny thee nothing:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Whereon, I do beseech thee, grant me this,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To leave me but a little to myself.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Shall I deny you? no: farewell, my lord.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Farewell, my Desdemona: I'll come to thee straight.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Emilia, come. Be as your fancies teach you;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Whate'er you be, I am obedient.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Exeunt DESDEMONA and EMILIA

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Excellent wretch! Perdition catch my soul,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But I do love thee! and when I love thee not,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Chaos is come again.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: My noble lord--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What dost thou say, Iago?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Did Michael Cassio, when you woo'd my lady,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Know of your love?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: He did, from first to last: why dost thou ask?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But for a satisfaction of my thought;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: No further harm.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Why of thy thought, Iago?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I did not think he had been acquainted with her.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O, yes; and went between us very oft.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Indeed!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Indeed! ay, indeed: discern'st thou aught in that?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Is he not honest?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Honest, my lord!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Honest! ay, honest.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: My lord, for aught I know.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What dost thou think?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Think, my lord!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Think, my lord!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: By heaven, he echoes me,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: As if there were some monster in his thought

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Too hideous to be shown. Thou dost mean something:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I heard thee say even now, thou likedst not that,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: When Cassio left my wife: what didst not like?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And when I told thee he was of my counsel

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: In my whole course of wooing, thou criedst 'Indeed!'

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And didst contract and purse thy brow together,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: As if thou then hadst shut up in thy brain

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Some horrible conceit: if thou dost love me,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Show me thy thought.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: My lord, you know I love you.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I think thou dost;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And, for I know thou'rt full of love and honesty,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And weigh'st thy words before thou givest them breath,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Therefore these stops of thine fright me the more:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For such things in a false disloyal knave

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Are tricks of custom, but in a man that's just

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: They are close delations, working from the heart

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That passion cannot rule.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For Michael Cassio,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I dare be sworn I think that he is honest.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I think so too.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Men should be what they seem;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Or those that be not, would they might seem none!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Certain, men should be what they seem.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why, then, I think Cassio's an honest man.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nay, yet there's more in this:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I prithee, speak to me as to thy thinkings,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: As thou dost ruminate, and give thy worst of thoughts

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The worst of words.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Good my lord, pardon me:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Though I am bound to every act of duty,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I am not bound to that all slaves are free to.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Utter my thoughts? Why, say they are vile and false;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As where's that palace whereinto foul things

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Sometimes intrude not? who has a breast so pure,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But some uncleanly apprehensions

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Keep leets and law-days and in session sit

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: With meditations lawful?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Thou dost conspire against thy friend, Iago,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If thou but think'st him wrong'd and makest his ear

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A stranger to thy thoughts.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I do beseech you--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Though I perchance am vicious in my guess,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As, I confess, it is my nature's plague

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To spy into abuses, and oft my jealousy

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Shapes faults that are not--that your wisdom yet,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: From one that so imperfectly conceits,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Would take no notice, nor build yourself a trouble

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Out of his scattering and unsure observance.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: It were not for your quiet nor your good,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nor for my manhood, honesty, or wisdom,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To let you know my thoughts.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What dost thou mean?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Good name in man and woman, dear my lord,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Is the immediate jewel of their souls:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Who steals my purse steals trash; 'tis something, nothing;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: 'Twas mine, 'tis his, and has been slave to thousands:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But he that filches from me my good name

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Robs me of that which not enriches him

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And makes me poor indeed.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: By heaven, I'll know thy thoughts.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You cannot, if my heart were in your hand;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nor shall not, whilst 'tis in my custody.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ha!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O, beware, my lord, of jealousy;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: It is the green-eyed monster which doth mock

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The meat it feeds on; that cuckold lives in bliss

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Who, certain of his fate, loves not his wronger;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But, O, what damned minutes tells he o'er

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Who dotes, yet doubts, suspects, yet strongly loves!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O misery!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Poor and content is rich and rich enough,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But riches fineless is as poor as winter

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To him that ever fears he shall be poor.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Good heaven, the souls of all my tribe defend

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: From jealousy!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Why, why is this?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Think'st thou I'ld make a lie of jealousy,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To follow still the changes of the moon

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: With fresh suspicions? No; to be once in doubt

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Is once to be resolved: exchange me for a goat,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: When I shall turn the business of my soul

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To such exsufflicate and blown surmises,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Matching thy inference. 'Tis not to make me jealous

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To say my wife is fair, feeds well, loves company,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Is free of speech, sings, plays and dances well;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Where virtue is, these are more virtuous:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nor from mine own weak merits will I draw

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The smallest fear or doubt of her revolt;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For she had eyes, and chose me. No, Iago;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I'll see before I doubt; when I doubt, prove;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And on the proof, there is no more but this,--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Away at once with love or jealousy!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I am glad of it; for now I shall have reason

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To show the love and duty that I bear you

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: With franker spirit: therefore, as I am bound,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Receive it from me. I speak not yet of proof.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Look to your wife; observe her well with Cassio;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Wear your eye thus, not jealous nor secure:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I would not have your free and noble nature,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Out of self-bounty, be abused; look to't:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I know our country disposition well;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: In Venice they do let heaven see the pranks

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: They dare not show their husbands; their best conscience

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Is not to leave't undone, but keep't unknown.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Dost thou say so?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She did deceive her father, marrying you;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And when she seem'd to shake and fear your looks,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She loved them most.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And so she did.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why, go to then;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She that, so young, could give out such a seeming,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To seal her father's eyes up close as oak-

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He thought 'twas witchcraft--but I am much to blame;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I humbly do beseech you of your pardon

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For too much loving you.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I am bound to thee for ever.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I see this hath a little dash'd your spirits.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Not a jot, not a jot.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I' faith, I fear it has.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I hope you will consider what is spoke

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Comes from my love. But I do see you're moved:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I am to pray you not to strain my speech

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To grosser issues nor to larger reach

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Than to suspicion.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I will not.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Should you do so, my lord,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: My speech should fall into such vile success

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As my thoughts aim not at. Cassio's my worthy friend--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: My lord, I see you're moved.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: No, not much moved:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I do not think but Desdemona's honest.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Long live she so! and long live you to think so!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And yet, how nature erring from itself,--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Ay, there's the point: as--to be bold with you--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Not to affect many proposed matches

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Of her own clime, complexion, and degree,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Whereto we see in all things nature tends--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Foh! one may smell in such a will most rank,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Foul disproportion thoughts unnatural.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But pardon me; I do not in position

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Distinctly speak of her; though I may fear

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Her will, recoiling to her better judgment,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: May fall to match you with her country forms

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And happily repent.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Farewell, farewell:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If more thou dost perceive, let me know more;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Set on thy wife to observe: leave me, Iago:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: [Going]  My lord, I take my leave.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Why did I marry? This honest creature doubtless

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Sees and knows more, much more, than he unfolds.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: [Returning]  My lord, I would I might entreat

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: your honour

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To scan this thing no further; leave it to time:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Though it be fit that Cassio have his place,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For sure, he fills it up with great ability,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Yet, if you please to hold him off awhile,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You shall by that perceive him and his means:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Note, if your lady strain his entertainment

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: With any strong or vehement importunity;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Much will be seen in that. In the mean time,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Let me be thought too busy in my fears--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As worthy cause I have to fear I am--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And hold her free, I do beseech your honour.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Fear not my government.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I once more take my leave.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: This fellow's of exceeding honesty,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And knows all qualities, with a learned spirit,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Of human dealings. If I do prove her haggard,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Though that her jesses were my dear heartstrings,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I'ld whistle her off and let her down the wind,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To pray at fortune. Haply, for I am black

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And have not those soft parts of conversation

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That chamberers have, or for I am declined

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Into the vale of years,--yet that's not much--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She's gone. I am abused; and my relief

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Must be to loathe her. O curse of marriage,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That we can call these delicate creatures ours,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And not their appetites! I had rather be a toad,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And live upon the vapour of a dungeon,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Than keep a corner in the thing I love

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For others' uses. Yet, 'tis the plague of great ones;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Prerogatived are they less than the base;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Tis destiny unshunnable, like death:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Even then this forked plague is fated to us

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: When we do quicken. Desdemona comes:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Re-enter DESDEMONA and EMILIA

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If she be false, O, then heaven mocks itself!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I'll not believe't.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: How now, my dear Othello!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Your dinner, and the generous islanders

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: By you invited, do attend your presence.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I am to blame.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Why do you speak so faintly?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Are you not well?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I have a pain upon my forehead here.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: 'Faith, that's with watching; 'twill away again:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Let me but bind it hard, within this hour

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: It will be well.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Your napkin is too little:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: He puts the handkerchief from him; and it drops

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Let it alone. Come, I'll go in with you.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I am very sorry that you are not well.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Exeunt OTHELLO and DESDEMONA

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I am glad I have found this napkin:

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: This was her first remembrance from the Moor:

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: My wayward husband hath a hundred times

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Woo'd me to steal it; but she so loves the token,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: For he conjured her she should ever keep it,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: That she reserves it evermore about her

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: To kiss and talk to. I'll have the work ta'en out,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And give't Iago: what he will do with it

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Heaven knows, not I;

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I nothing but to please his fantasy.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Re-enter Iago

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How now! what do you here alone?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Do not you chide; I have a thing for you.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: A thing for me? it is a common thing--

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Ha!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To have a foolish wife.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: O, is that all? What will you give me now

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: For the same handkerchief?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What handkerchief?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: What handkerchief?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Why, that the Moor first gave to Desdemona;

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: That which so often you did bid me steal.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Hast stol'n it from her?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: No, 'faith; she let it drop by negligence.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And, to the advantage, I, being here, took't up.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Look, here it is.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: A good wench; give it me.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: What will you do with 't, that you have been

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: so earnest

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: To have me filch it?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: [Snatching it]  Why, what's that to you?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: If it be not for some purpose of import,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Give't me again: poor lady, she'll run mad

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: When she shall lack it.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Be not acknown on 't; I have use for it.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Go, leave me.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exit EMILIA

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I will in Cassio's lodging lose this napkin,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And let him find it. Trifles light as air

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Are to the jealous confirmations strong

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As proofs of holy writ: this may do something.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The Moor already changes with my poison:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Dangerous conceits are, in their natures, poisons.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Which at the first are scarce found to distaste,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But with a little act upon the blood.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Burn like the mines of Sulphur. I did say so:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Look, where he comes!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Re-enter OTHELLO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Not poppy, nor mandragora,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nor all the drowsy syrups of the world,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Shall ever medicine thee to that sweet sleep

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Which thou owedst yesterday.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ha! ha! false to me?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why, how now, general! no more of that.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Avaunt! be gone! thou hast set me on the rack:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I swear 'tis better to be much abused

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Than but to know't a little.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How now, my lord!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What sense had I of her stol'n hours of lust?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I saw't not, thought it not, it harm'd not me:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I slept the next night well, was free and merry;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I found not Cassio's kisses on her lips:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: He that is robb'd, not wanting what is stol'n,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Let him not know't, and he's not robb'd at all.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I am sorry to hear this.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I had been happy, if the general camp,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Pioners and all, had tasted her sweet body,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: So I had nothing known. O, now, for ever

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Farewell the tranquil mind! farewell content!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Farewell the plumed troop, and the big wars,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That make ambition virtue! O, farewell!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Farewell the neighing steed, and the shrill trump,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The spirit-stirring drum, the ear-piercing fife,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The royal banner, and all quality,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Pride, pomp and circumstance of glorious war!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And, O you mortal engines, whose rude throats

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The immortal Jove's dead clamours counterfeit,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Farewell! Othello's occupation's gone!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Is't possible, my lord?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Villain, be sure thou prove my love a whore,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Be sure of it; give me the ocular proof:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Or by the worth of man's eternal soul,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Thou hadst been better have been born a dog

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Than answer my waked wrath!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Is't come to this?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Make me to see't; or, at the least, so prove it,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That the probation bear no hinge nor loop

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To hang a doubt on; or woe upon thy life!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: My noble lord,--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If thou dost slander her and torture me,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Never pray more; abandon all remorse;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: On horror's head horrors accumulate;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Do deeds to make heaven weep, all earth amazed;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For nothing canst thou to damnation add

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Greater than that.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O grace! O heaven forgive me!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Are you a man? have you a soul or sense?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: God be wi' you; take mine office. O wretched fool.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That livest to make thine honesty a vice!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O monstrous world! Take note, take note, O world,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To be direct and honest is not safe.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I thank you for this profit; and from hence

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I'll love no friend, sith love breeds such offence.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nay, stay: thou shouldst be honest.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I should be wise, for honesty's a fool

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And loses that it works for.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: By the world,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I think my wife be honest and think she is not;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I think that thou art just and think thou art not.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I'll have some proof. Her name, that was as fresh

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: As Dian's visage, is now begrimed and black

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: As mine own face. If there be cords, or knives,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Poison, or fire, or suffocating streams,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I'll not endure it. Would I were satisfied!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I see, sir, you are eaten up with passion:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I do repent me that I put it to you.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You would be satisfied?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Would! nay, I will.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And may: but, how? how satisfied, my lord?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Would you, the supervisor, grossly gape on--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Behold her topp'd?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Death and damnation! O!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: It were a tedious difficulty, I think,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To bring them to that prospect: damn them then,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If ever mortal eyes do see them bolster

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: More than their own! What then? how then?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What shall I say? Where's satisfaction?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: It is impossible you should see this,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Were they as prime as goats, as hot as monkeys,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As salt as wolves in pride, and fools as gross

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As ignorance made drunk. But yet, I say,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If imputation and strong circumstances,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Which lead directly to the door of truth,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Will give you satisfaction, you may have't.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Give me a living reason she's disloyal.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I do not like the office:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But, sith I am enter'd in this cause so far,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Prick'd to't by foolish honesty and love,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I will go on. I lay with Cassio lately;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And, being troubled with a raging tooth,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I could not sleep.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: There are a kind of men so loose of soul,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That in their sleeps will mutter their affairs:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: One of this kind is Cassio:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: In sleep I heard him say 'Sweet Desdemona,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Let us be wary, let us hide our loves;'

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And then, sir, would he gripe and wring my hand,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Cry 'O sweet creature!' and then kiss me hard,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As if he pluck'd up kisses by the roots

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That grew upon my lips: then laid his leg

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Over my thigh, and sigh'd, and kiss'd; and then

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Cried 'Cursed fate that gave thee to the Moor!'

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O monstrous! monstrous!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nay, this was but his dream.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But this denoted a foregone conclusion:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Tis a shrewd doubt, though it be but a dream.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And this may help to thicken other proofs

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That do demonstrate thinly.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I'll tear her all to pieces.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nay, but be wise: yet we see nothing done;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She may be honest yet. Tell me but this,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Have you not sometimes seen a handkerchief

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Spotted with strawberries in your wife's hand?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I gave her such a one; 'twas my first gift.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I know not that; but such a handkerchief--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I am sure it was your wife's--did I to-day

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: See Cassio wipe his beard with.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If it be that--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If it be that, or any that was hers,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: It speaks against her with the other proofs.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O, that the slave had forty thousand lives!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: One is too poor, too weak for my revenge.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Now do I see 'tis true. Look here, Iago;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: All my fond love thus do I blow to heaven.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Tis gone.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Arise, black vengeance, from thy hollow cell!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Yield up, O love, thy crown and hearted throne

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To tyrannous hate! Swell, bosom, with thy fraught,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For 'tis of aspics' tongues!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Yet be content.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O, blood, blood, blood!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Patience, I say; your mind perhaps may change.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Never, Iago: Like to the Pontic sea,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Whose icy current and compulsive course

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ne'er feels retiring ebb, but keeps due on

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To the Propontic and the Hellespont,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Even so my bloody thoughts, with violent pace,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Shall ne'er look back, ne'er ebb to humble love,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Till that a capable and wide revenge

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Swallow them up. Now, by yond marble heaven,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Kneels

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: In the due reverence of a sacred vow

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I here engage my words.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Do not rise yet.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Kneels

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Witness, you ever-burning lights above,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You elements that clip us round about,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Witness that here Iago doth give up

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The execution of his wit, hands, heart,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To wrong'd Othello's service! Let him command,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And to obey shall be in me remorse,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What bloody business ever.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: They rise

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I greet thy love,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Not with vain thanks, but with acceptance bounteous,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And will upon the instant put thee to't:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Within these three days let me hear thee say

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That Cassio's not alive.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: My friend is dead; 'tis done at your request:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But let her live.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Damn her, lewd minx! O, damn her!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Come, go with me apart; I will withdraw,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To furnish me with some swift means of death

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For the fair devil. Now art thou my lieutenant.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I am your own for ever.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exeunt
